physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Elevated serum T3 levels (54% and 60% above the upper limit of normal) and low T4 levels (26% and 20% below the lower limit of normal) were noted in twins at 18 months. Normal TSH levels were observed (4.0 and 3.7 mU/liter). Heart rate decline was noted in three of the four subjects after treatment.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Treatment with DITPA normalized or near-normalized thyroid function tests, with a documented improvement in T3 and T4 levels after reaching a dose of 1 mg/kg.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Serum T3 levels were elevated (54% and 60% above normal), low T4 levels (26% and 20% below normal), and normal TSH (4.0 and 3.7 mU/liter).
Heart rate decline in three of four children; improvement in serum T3 and T4 post-DITPA treatment.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After reaching a dose of 1 mg/kg, T3 levels normalized in all subjects.
